intro: Pimpinella tomentosa, commonly known as the wooly cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is often found in woodland and grassland habitats. It has a taproot system and produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
